like "Hey if you come work for us we're going to make you an architect because you're already a senior we're going to make you an architect." And that's a

today with their future somewhere else so what you failed to do as an employer
at that point is to very visualize uh to visualize to them what their career
would look like with you and it's very easy to forget that because we're all struggling to just get

we also added some custom questions that were very specific to the way that we do things also to get a little bit of a

now salary negotiations is something that you cannot just avoid right the

entire compensation packages so we felt that it was a good idea to do

for everyone to actually do it and we would expect both of the sides of the

making the year that's behind us self-evident and we do that by putting good follow-up

the person doing the pain negotiation and if they have grown a lot they should get a bigger raise and if they have

against the rest of the market there are agencies that will do this for you um they have standardized categories for

your employees and how many years of experience they have how many years of experience they have at the company what

pro person is probably a little bit overpaid there's usually reasons for that
um don't be blind to this because if you're underpaying someone that means
that the offer will be so much sweeter somewhere else so that's a gap you need to close so if you know that there is
some pressure there then you should be actively giving them bigger raises every year because they're
underpaid right and it's not if you don't do this on a regular
basis you're just putting your head in the sand and you're blind to whatever is going on

um and that's cool but I could schedule whatever
